website_summaries.verdict: A compact model by a top name in grills that comes with both user-friendly features and a few quirks.
pros: With a 160-square-inch cooking surface, foldable design, and sturdy carrying handle, this model is ideal for tailgating
Owners rave about how little charcoal it takes to prepare a meal
cons: Challenging to achieve ideal cooking temperatures
Food tends to stick to the grill plate

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: Used this within a week of receiving! We are still trying to learn how to utilize it best but the design is perfect for slow and coal flavor infusing cooking. Extremely happy with this purchase. Additionally, I ended up ditching the bottom metal rack to hold coal above the pan (for ash collecting purpose). Having that rack made the coal too close to my food; I was afraid of burning my food. So i laid the burning coal directly on the metal bottom of the grill and it was fine. No burnt food and the metal bottom held out against the coal well.
customer_reviews.author: WonderWoman

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Grill
customer_reviews.text: We've had this grill for at least two years now. We keep it in the front storage compartment of our 5th Wheel. It is easy to setup and take down. Does a good job holding temp. We either set it up on a folding metal camp table or on top of the campsite grill. Of all the portable grills we've had for our RV's this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: bad grill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago. I used it 3 times. The problem is that the interior height is too shallow. the distance between the food and the charcoal is so small that the food sometimes touches the coal. The coal is very hot. The food gets burnt on the outside and raw on the inside. I regret buying it. If there were a negative star, I would give it a negative rating.
customer_reviews.author: reviewk1

customer_reviews.title: Problematic Design for Outdoor Grilling
customer_reviews.text: I received the grill and was excited to have a compact tabletop grill for the patio. Unfortunately the grill isn't deep enough to hold enough charcoal to get nice grilling coals going. It needs to be about an inch deeper for it to fully work. Because it isn't deep enough, the food burns easily since it's too close to the charcoal. Also, you really can't grill that much food on it, barely enough for two people. The grill needs to be re-designed to adequately serve its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Comfort

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control enamal coating chipped off
customer_reviews.text: inside of the coating was chipped off on the right side size of a BIC lighter and left size of quarter which quality control should have caught immediately before shipping. Hard to believe no one caught this oblivious flaw through the entire assemble and packaging line. I expect after some use these will only get bigger and start rusting with heat from charcoal. The size and portable design appears to be well thought out as Weber are known to be durable. I guess Weber don't care about quality but the box states 10 year warranty USA. Disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, portable & easy to clean: a great alternative to "mangal" to make kebabs.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this grill. You can cook five to six long kebobs or about eight sideways. The distance to the edge is just perfect. I had no problem cooking 5 NY strip steaks. Temperature and flair up control is excellent with the lid. Very solid and well built product.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Bottom charcoal holder curls up. Handles burn up!
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap! The bottom charcoal holder curls up after first use. Handles burn up!
customer_reviews.author: Schnitzel

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2016 I think. I still have it. It's what it is and not what it's not. It's a smallish portable grill with a lid and lots of air holes. I've used it many times. Usually, it's like a Hibachi, but I've smoked ribs on it by carefully controlling the air flow, charcoal heat, smoke, etc. It's really just a small grill, but it's held up for years. I think durability is the asset here, for otherwise, it's just a small charcoal grill.
customer_reviews.author: Tars Tarkas

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the hot handle on the lid
customer_reviews.text: Returned it as the handle on top reached temps between 300-400F because Weber went cheap and spared the heat reflector as they had before. A buddy burned his fingers not knowing about it. Otherwise loved the rectangular setup where you easily can define a direct and an indirect zone. I probably go with a PK Grill now instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mauiman

customer_reviews.title: convenient once you put it together
customer_reviews.text: This grill came with great reviews. It also came with worthless instructions. I had to go the Youtube to find out how to put it together. It turned out that I did not have all the screws needed to put the handles on. I am calling customer service to see if I can get them mailed to me. Very annoying. I called customer service and she was very empathetic and helpful. She sent me a handle with a screw. Be aware that the screw for each handle is embedded with the handle. You have to take it apart to find the screw. Separate carefully so that the screw does not fall out. The BBQ works well and is very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Wandering shopper

customer_reviews.title: No brainer purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was exploring ways to buy other cheaper options. But, the practicality of this item along with the brand reputation was more than enough to go with this. Just tried only once, and everything just went well. I had a bit confusion when fitting the handle as they were not becoming too tight to be together. Anyways, that wasn't a big concern. I am using the box that it came with as cover to carry in the car to avoid any leftover dust from spreading out in the trunk. Go for it! Don't think too much about cheaper options. This looks lasting and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dictator

customer_reviews.title: Convenient size and weight. Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: A light weight compact charcoal grill for camping. Assembly was easy. Clever design, legs become locks for lid. RelativelyThin metal. Temperature control was a challenge for me. Vents in lid and bottom work together with periodical adjustments necessary for the charcoal to burn off completely. It’ll probably last a couple of seasons. The price is worth it to me for the convenience of size. Holds 6 burgers, three large steaks About ten hotdogs.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Slomba

customer_reviews.title: POOR Quality hardware..CHEAP CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: The screws that came with the grill were CHEAP and the phillips heads stripped out before the handles were tight. I had to find substitute screws of better quality.. It is disappointing that Weber couldn't have spent a few more pennies and provided decent quality screws for the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Hining

customer_reviews.title: Trust me on this one
customer_reviews.text: This is one strong little thing and I think the legs won’t give out anytime soon. If you use a reasonable cast iron pot or pan and you will be fine with it. The vents are a little thin, but I am sure they are just fine as Weber is quality not quantity. I am so glad I got this. It’s not some lite weight knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W Hendrick

customer_reviews.title: Just trying to assemble it, already pissing me off.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even used it yet, I can tell its a BBQ, so its gonna function like one. It has temp control, enough space for charcoal, too much charcoal, you'll burn the food, not enough, it wont cook. That part isn't an issue. But I'm just trying to screw the handles to the frame, and the screw holes literally aren't deep enough or something. I used all my strength to turn the screw into the plastic, and the handles, all 3, are still loose and move around a lot. they even seperate a little bit, and its incredibly annoying. "Ease" of assembly is a 4 or 5, but build quality is a 2 at best...
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Dorcas

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Weber Smokey Joe user for many years. I needed a grill that I could take in my small camper & ordered this based on the WEBER name & performance of all the others I own. This product is a very big disappointment as I bought it to slow cook & smoke various cuts of meat as I do with my other 2 I have at home. This one blows smoke out every little nook & cranny & cooks way too fast for my liking. As a normal hamburger, hot dog & steak grill I'm sure it would work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlene L.

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to tighten the handles.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use my grill yet. I have been trying to put the handles on the grill, but the screws are so hard screw in that I cannot tighten them using all my strength. I can't put enough pressure on the screw to keep the Philips screw driver from slipping and rounding off the top of the screw slot. When I put as much pressure on the screw as I can I am not strong enough to turn the screw.
customer_reviews.author: HerbB52

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Camping
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for the perfect grill to take truck camping into remote areas. This grill folds down super nicely, and everything latches together. To prevent a mess, I've fit it into a Rubbermaid Roughneck 18 gallon tote on an angle. That leaves space for other grilling gear. As a tip, this grill is too hot to use on a plastic table. So plan on putting it on the ground or on a table designed to take some heat. Awesome Weber quality and portability.
customer_reviews.author: GamesOgre

customer_reviews.title: Screws don't fit; missing items
customer_reviews.text: DON'T DO IT TO YOURSELF!!! I am so disappointed that Weber would send out a product that has missing items and Phillips screws that are incompatible with the handles. This was a huge disappointment for my family today. We were really looking forward to firing up the grill. I've tried several different times to contact Weber, but I have not been able to access anyone. Also, I wholeheartedly believe that a lot of the five star reviews are questionable. I am learning that many of these corporations pay for reviews or give incentives to change reviews. If I were y'all I wouldn't trust it.
customer_reviews.author: ShortGirl253

customer_reviews.title: Best little hibachi I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of camping and have purchased a few portable grills over the years, and this is by far the best one. Portable yet compact and with enough space to cook for a large group if you stick to hot dogs, hamburgers and shish kabobs. I've also found myself using it over my larger grill for home weeknight cooking, it's the ideal size for a dinner for two with steaks and veggies. Lid and shape gives excellent control of two zone cooking, so you can get one side roaring hot for searing and browning veggies, while still having a baking side for letting steaks rest and absorb all that smoke flavor.
customer_reviews.author: C. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Mr Weber-you listening?
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great buy The only disappointment was the side carrying handles do not assemble snap tight. A gap is formed in which when you go to pick it up it pinches the crap out of the inside of your palms. Not good. Overall it’s a good product. I think Mr Weber himself should get one and see what we’re talking about. Have it correct it, and then send me a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Solo Bear

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing quality but grills well.
customer_reviews.text: While the grill works well there are two safety issues. First, the bracket that is supposed to hold the legs together DOESN'T. We got some silicone twist ties to hold them together. Second, the handle gets extremely hot. Keep a pot holder close by. A better heat proof handle would be a good up grade.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra  K Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I bought this as a Father’s Day gift. He loved it. I like the compact storage is provides. The bottom rack to hold the charcoal was a little too close to the meat. So we just put aluminum foil on the bottom of the grill and made sure the vents were not covered. Worked great. Wash clean up as well. No hardware melted (like I had seen in other reviews), not sure what happened with their’s. The surface fits a good amount of meat/veggies as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small family
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a small family , Though designed for outings may be, I bought it to use it at my house and also when I go out. I used it more than 25 times last summer. I cleaned the same day , immediately after using it and it looks as good as nee , except the frame where the charcoal burns . couple of times I used it continuously for 3 to 4 hours to prep food for 3 to 4 families, not a scratch ... Its perfect. I think I will have no problem using it for another 2 summers.
customer_reviews.author: BNKV

customer_reviews.title: Don't agree with negative reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at some of the reviews and was a little nervous about buying this, but I have been delighted with it. Some said the legs were flimsy. Not on mine. It was very easy to assemble - just follow directions. Have used it and it works great!! Used the suggestion someone came up with to line the bottom with heavy duty foil, wait til coals are cold, and just dispose of responsibly.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Big Green Egg in a small black box
customer_reviews.text: The perfect camp grill. Very well made. Thick metal and retains heat well. Good airflow control. They've been making this model since 1979 and it shows. I'm a Big Green Egg guy and this grill works great with the Lump Charcoal I use in my egg. I get the same grill flavor I love at home while I'm camping riverside. Gamechanger! I can fit all my grilling utensils inside, my charcoal chimney, butane torch & canister plus 2 vacuum sealed bags (measured out 1 per night) of lump inside the grill while transporting. I found a dry tote this grill fits into, making this the perfect raft overnighter grill. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: TriStar

customer_reviews.title: I love it! We only need a small grill for ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! We only need a small grill for occasional use, but wanted something substantial enough to hold up. It heats every bit as well as my old large grill, but stores on a small shelf in my laundry room. I was concerned after reading reviews about the area for charcoal being too narrow to hold enough, but I didn't have any problem at all with this. It easily held enough charcoal to grill six hamburgers, with plenty of heat left over for s'mores afterward.
customer_reviews.author: minderbinder

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill!
customer_reviews.text: Went camping in a remote dry region. Took this with so I wouldn’t have to create a fire. Worked great for burgers, Carne asada, bacon and eggs, and more. Well worth it. My only recommendation is to put tin foil on top of the charcoal grates to speed up cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Camerissimo

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Ya get what you pay for  :-)
customer_reviews.text: Replacing a Smokey Joe for better portability. Smokey Joe takes up too much room in our storage compartment in our travel trailer (it's like trying to stuff a basketball in a mailbox). Performs better overall and holds more food. Cooked a 1.5"x3"x7" Rib Eye perfectly in min 20 minutes (did as well as my pit boss). Nice to have an area of indirect heat to move off to as well as direct heat. Got my moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grill any time and anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Works great for its size. Not that heavy which is great. Its size does a good job; been able to cook a 1.5”ish steak without the steak touching the top cover. Few things to keep in mind is you want to be aware of how much charcoal you use, if you stack the charcoal high then it’ll really heat up the grill and you could potentially burn your food. Another thing is the handle also gets very hot, too hot to grab, if you’re using a decent amount of charcoal so a glove or rag is a must when picking up The cover.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: This little grill works perfect for us on our camping trips
customer_reviews.text: This little grill works perfect for us on our camping trips. We've used it about 5 times now and have no complaints. I will post again if there is any problem but so far we love it. We have a small camper so we needed a grill can be stored in a small space. I would recommend this grill..
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Just right for 2
customer_reviews.text: I've had the same Weber kettle BBQ for more than 20 years, outside in the rain, snow, hail and heat, and it still works fine. But the kids are gone and it was just too big for my wife and I. Found the "Go Anywhere" and love it! Lights quick and will easily fit 4 hamburgers. Perfect tor 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: RandiG

customer_reviews.title: Weber nailed it with this little guy
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Needed a travel grill, and didn't have a charcoal grill so I gave this a run. My main grill is a Weber Genesis 3, so I guess I'm a bit of a fan boi, lol. This go-anywhere can easily grill for 4. I am finding myself firing it up at home just for fun. Quality parts and nice design, as expected from Weber. I paired it with the compact charcoal chimney #7447 which fills half the of this grill with hot coals.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable grill
customer_reviews.text: We have had a Weber kettle and a genesis for years, so we thought we would try the go anywhere for trips. We have used the go anywhere for burgers and veg. It worked well and took maybe 15min to set up . The materials seem to be sturdy. Item was packaged well with no damage. The handles seem fine and were easily attached with a screwdriver. All the necessary accessories (small weber chimney starter, scraper, spatula, griddle) fit in it for transportation. It works well for portability and small grill sessions. With a little aluminum foil to line bottom, it was also easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed portable grill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on vacation- after reading reviews of other small, inexpensive grills, they all seemed to be rated as flimsy, difficult to assemble, and quick to rust. I decided to spend a little more on this one, and I like it a lot so far. The foldable legs are ingenious for use, and for folding up and locking in place to travel. Worked great for cooking for the 3 of us. Remains to be seen about durability and not rusting- fingers crossed, and happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it love it love it ! Our first charcoal grill
customer_reviews.text: The perfect size for grilling. Very sturdy, extremely portable and easy to carry. We took this with us in our camping trip. So much better than having to use the ones at campsites. No offense but those are not usually cleaned and being a vegetarian - it was a big deal for us. Would surely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PeterSLC

customer_reviews.title: My husband closes the air vents when done grilling and the coals stay good to start the next night's meal
customer_reviews.text: We take this grill in our RV and use it all the time when camping. My husband closes the air vents when done grilling and the coals stay good to start the next night's meal. Good way to save on having to take as big a bag of briquettes as storage space is limited in the RV.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great for grilling!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a grilling enthusiast with lots of time on a 22 inch weber kettle. I bought this small grill for quick daily meals. I've used it for steaks, burgers, hotdogs, chicken, and vegetables so far. All have come out amazing so far. With the lid off, it creates a delicious dark brown sear on meat (use a full chimney of charcoal for searing). With the lid on, it is a piece of cake to go low and slow by closing the vents down. I can fit three large ribeye steaks on at the same time or about 8 quarter lb. burgers without being too cramped. Very easy to fully clean as well. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Mills

customer_reviews.title: OH MY GOODNESS!
customer_reviews.text: Great culinary activity off this small, but beautiful grill. Carry it down the sidewalk and set up a great cooking experience anyplace one is allowed to do so. Top of the line and very economical. (in other words it is cheap in cost)
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I have the 26” Weber great for when people are over. This one is perfect for just my wife and I. It is aWeber so will last a long time. It is easy to take with you. The Weber grill tools fit in it which makes it easy transport.
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Took on our first camping trip, worked great. Stuck it on top of the campgrounds grill bar so it was in a safe spot. Wasn't sure if you could cook it on the table or not if it was up high enough. It fits nicely in the Plano tote we got for it, and put all our "fire/cooking" stuff all in there. Including the small bag of charcoal will tuck nicely right inside the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Terrible heat distribution.  Donated it to a thrift store
customer_reviews.text: We took this for a 3 day camping trip on an uninhabited island. I really should have tried it out before I went. Basically it was so bad I had to finish cooking the steaks in a frying pan. About all it is good for is s’mores. If I hadn’t brought a portable burner, it would have ruined the trip
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are misleading
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill because it had the dimensions needed to accomodate my rotisserie. However, the product descriiption dimensions said 21" wide. In fact, it is only 16" wide (long). It is also only about 10" wide vs 12" in the description.
customer_reviews.author: ducks54

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t stay hot with the lid on!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the grill! The only problem is it doesn’t stay hot very long when you put the lid on unfortunately! Other than that it’s a cute little option to grill burgers, hotdogs & steaks. I can fit a nice amount of food on it as well. Enough for 4 people!
customer_reviews.author: Ticia

customer_reviews.title: Great little smoker!
customer_reviews.text: This little baby is a trooper. Weber quality to-go. I definitely recommend this over the smokey joe if you are looking for a portable grill. I personally use this grill as a smoker more than a grill. There's a heat deflector sold here on Amazon. The deflector allows you to be able to use the WHOLE grilling surface for smoking as opposed to indirect cooking. HIGHLY reccomend that deflector for smoking purposes.
customer_reviews.author: McMats

customer_reviews.title: dented lid -- problem resolved
customer_reviews.text: the lid is dented in two of the four corners............I have contacted Weber twice and received no reply. Very disappointing. If I do not hear from them soon, I will have to return. When the emails didn't work, I called Weber. Problem solved...they are sending a new cover and I am a happy camper. Trust in Weber thankfully restored.
customer_reviews.author: G Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Add a thermometer!
customer_reviews.text: Grill is great and portable but the vent slides could jam at times. It’s a lightweight aluminum so it bends easily. Otherwise, easy to get a +400degree fire for searing or just some hot coals. I like this grill because its flat so coals can be more even than concentrated in the middle. Does not have a thermometer. I drilled a hole through the top and installed a cheap one I found.
customer_reviews.author: mr name

customer_reviews.title: Ten Years Old - still Kicking / Grilling 🔥♥️it
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill! It is perfect snd compact. Mine has been outdoors in the weather and this one is ten years old I'm guessing Brought it eon today to clean it up and restart it on patio. If there is some type of really good waterproof cover for it would buy it today (actually why I am online looking. Anyone?! Thanks. I figured this cheap grill would have died off years ago but it keeps on grilling
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bott

customer_reviews.title: Easy to transport and use
customer_reviews.text: Prefect little grill for the beach,camping or etc. Compact lite easy too use.
customer_reviews.author: Big Rich

customer_reviews.title: what a great design
customer_reviews.text: This grill has a great design with attention to details, it has lock system for safe handling, reasonable space and dimensions that allows a good grilling experience and the materials used is high quality, have been using it for a while and absolutely loved it.
customer_reviews.author: PN

customer_reviews.title: Great small, portable grill
customer_reviews.text: Great small portable grill. Easy set up, clean up and put-away. I added Craycort's Go Grate 2 piece cast iron grill, available on Amazon. A worthwhile upgrade for me. (see you tube reviews.) Note: only 2 1/4" between fire grate and grill grate. Some lump charcoal pieces may be too big to fit. I'm still "researching" charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalBill

customer_reviews.title: NICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Christmas. It is just what we have been looking for! I have bought several (too many) small kettle grills of the Walmart variety. We use it camping and we're lucky of we can get a season out of it before it rusts thru. This grill seems to be Weber quality. It got my attention because it comes with the Weber guarantee. It isn't huge but perfect for a couple of steaks, a few burgers (6) or a batch of wings (24?).
customer_reviews.author: Debra S. Conaway

customer_reviews.title: Best little grill ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Weber grill for several years now. It is absolutely the best little grill I've ever had. Been used hundreds of times, still just as good as new. I've used both firewood and charcoal, cooked everything, salmon, hamburgers, steaks, hot dogs, coffee...all good! I'm ordering another, as a gift for a friend, today!
customer_reviews.author: tmexrea

customer_reviews.title: Can only put one layer of charcoal along entire grill
customer_reviews.text: Grill is absolutely lousy. There's only enough room for one layer of briquettes. As a result once you spread the hot coals out you end up with hot spots and cold spots and everything Cooks uneven and you have no way to add more coals for second layer or to raise or lower height of the grill. Never buy this product again Weber made a mistake
customer_reviews.author: Accurite

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly - Space Saving - Portable
customer_reviews.text: I just got my Weber portable grill today. Since this is the case I cannot speak on performance, quality, or capacity but it was easy to assemble. It is portable, easy to store and does not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Raines

customer_reviews.title: The handles are made of a cheap plastic,
customer_reviews.text: The handles and the screws to hold them together stripped upon my first turn (I'm a weskish old lady so the screws should have been able to take my strength) So the handles are loose and not sturdy. I can't undo them either so I expect one day for it to come toppling off altogether and the grill will land on the floor
customer_reviews.author: Ellie C

customer_reviews.title: Major pinching issue with handling
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of parts to assemble. Directions are just pictures. Only complaint, and it is a big one, is that the plastic handles don't screw together completely. Tried repeatedly, trying to do outside one into metal and interior piece afterwards - didn't work. Pinched the crap out of my fingers picking it up. If we like the grill, we may just Gorilla tape it together. Haven't used yet so can't comment beyond assembly
customer_reviews.author: NONE

customer_reviews.title: Not a yakatori grill, but solid product
customer_reviews.text: Tried to make use of it for yakatori type grilling with low smoke high heat charcoal. Only downside was a solid start with regular charcoal was required to get up to high heat. Required some finesse to get the skewers rocking across the width, but does work for two batches of chicken thighs with the coals it can max hold. Still doesn't get the heat of a ceramic unit (obviously), but has come to be a good friend next to the gas grill when charcoal is required for flavor.
customer_reviews.author: JohnA

customer_reviews.title: Good quality will work for years
customer_reviews.text: I use charcoal grills for a long time and saw many of these. This one has the best quality metal. Really well made. I have a big grill outside but sometimes i need something portable- this one is perfect solution. just as other people suggested put alumnium foil on the bottom but do not block vents- will be really easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Small grill, big performance!
customer_reviews.text: For a small grill this thing really performs. The four vent system makes indirect heat grilling and smoking very easy. I highly recommend it if you need a small grill. Perfect for two people. Again the best feature is the four vent system. It reminds me of the four vent system of a PK grill.
customer_reviews.author: Godfrey Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: My favorite grill! Folds very easy, very compact, easy to clean. I usually carry it in my trunk with charcoal in it. Whenever I need it, it's right there and I start grilling:) You might think it is too small but you can grill a ton of stuff in there.
customer_reviews.author: Arman

customer_reviews.title: Compact and portable. Great value for your money!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this grill! We cook right on our wrought iron patio table and still have plenty of room for the plates and glasses. We bought a second one for our RV. We use a charcoal chimney full of hardwood charcoal and it is the perfect amount to cook your meal. The vents can closed when you are finished cooking to save the coals for your next cookout!
customer_reviews.author: L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Easy Cleanup, Cooks Well
customer_reviews.text: Though it doesn't look very large, this grill actually can hold quite a bit. You can grill a rack of ribs at a pretty consistent temperature with this, but it's not very easy to load charcoal onto one side and cook at different temperatures due to the size. Once charcoal is removed/put out, I found this grill to cool off enough to touch/store within 7-10 minutes on a hot day. Easy to clean, easy to use. The only reason this isn't a 5 star review is because sometimes the vents aren't very easy to deal with, especially when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Dadtrn

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to campground grills
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing. I don't trust campground grills so I bought this. Works very well and I like how the legs fold up to secure the lid and contents. Only concern is the side vents have to he up (open) when the legs are up which can cause any remaining ash to cause a mess. I haul it in my truck so not a issue for me but just he aware. Not worth losing a star over.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy, nice and small
customer_reviews.text: Had a cheap version of this until it rusted through. Used it it on camping trips The Weber is much more solid and sturdy. Think I’m going to get many years out of this one. By the way, these little guys make the best steaks ever. Maybe cause the heat/smoke is so direct in a small space, but I can’t replicate it on my home Weber grill.
customer_reviews.author: D.Sab

customer_reviews.title: Love it...
customer_reviews.text: I love this little grill. Bought it to replace a very old, round Weber and this is perfect. I like the rectangular shape so much better, it's also nice and heavy and being able to hinge the lid up for a wind break works perfect. I usually grill for just two or three people and the size is perfect for that with room left over to move food to a cooler area or to toast hotdog/hamburger buns off to the side etc.
customer_reviews.author: CAfarmgirlTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Little hard to get the hang of of this little grill cooks,but once I did..I LOVE it! Great for renters..light,easy to clean & store!! Uses little charcoal..I love being able to grill again!!!💕🍔
customer_reviews.author: TerriT.13

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping... I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I really like my little grill... I use it for camping. It's very well made and heavy duty... The coating is awesome and I know this will be in use for a long time The handles are a bit flimsy. But that has no effect on the quality...
customer_reviews.author: L. lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Space saving, Portable, & Value! 💯
customer_reviews.text: Living in apartments & loving to BBQ on the beach this was exactly what I was looking for! •Space saving •Easily Portable •Quality •Simple Assembly I’m extremely happy with this little grill, and love it’s clean design that doubles with its portable mode features and more!
customer_reviews.author: Melly

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It is made of quality material. Portable and great design! It has just enough cooking area, no less or more. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amzn Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute lunch box grill with a decent capability! Cleaned easily and durable. No dents, scratches, or enamel issues. Easy to set up, but a little awkward to bend the metal legs underneath. Minimal assembly but you will need a screwdriver. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Luke & Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for camping.
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill for camping trips. Perfect height when sitting on the tailgate of my pickup truck. Well built unit. The black paint and chrome finishes are flawless. The only way it could be better is if it had come preassembled.
customer_reviews.author: HeavyMetalMechanic

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: this LITTLE grill is well made but much smaller than i thought. I grill for just me and my wife so I though it would be big enough, but its not really I also have a hard time keeping the charcoal lit. I have tried different types but they all go out. Might just be me.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Very shallow. Very little space between cooking grate and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very shallow. Very little space between cooking grate and charcoal. Difficult to get correct temperature and grill
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Makes great brats and hamburgers
customer_reviews.text: Used it first time last night and the grill is small enough to be portable but surface holds 6 - 8 patties. Good alternative after moving and having to sell our large grill.
customer_reviews.author: Snow

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little charcoal grill. My husband loves his gas grill, but I love the flavor of charcoal. I bought this for our “gold panning” trips, but I have it set up on my deck now. It works great for steaks for two.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Bonnie Serrett

customer_reviews.title: Handy small charcoal grill
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to travel in our camper. Just right for the two of us.
customer_reviews.author: Happy retired husband

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted...
customer_reviews.text: I had a jillion year old "some other brand" of grill like this one and it finally wore out so this one fills the bill just fine. I like that the legs can be clipped so they won't accidentally move while the grill is in use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little grill I purchased Craycort cast iron grates and a BBQube heat deflector Both great additions I have cooked steaks burgers and pork chops on the cast iron grate and cooked a slab of ribs using the heat deflector and standard grate
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Great small grill
customer_reviews.text: We like to travel with a small grill; this is not the smallest we have purchased but it may be the most durable and most effective. I wish it were a bit smaller and I do worry that over time the legs might give, but at least after a few months it has been great to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Serendipity

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: It's a great portable grill. Very compact and sturdy for a lightweight grill you are going to put in and out of your trunk and lug to a picnic spot. The vents close down tight so, once emptied of ash, they seal up pretty well for relatively low mess transport. Haven't road tested it, but it will happen now that the weather is nice! Buy this grill. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Thinkosaurus

customer_reviews.title: Made the right choice with this one.
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill. Took me about 5 minutes to put it together with a screwdriver. The sheet metal is sturdy and not too thin, and the grates are well made. I can see this little beauty lasting for years. We bought this for our camper and it works perfectly on a folding cook table we bought to accompany it. The cooking surface was much larger and evenly heated than other units that we looked at (where the charcoal would be deeper at certain areas.
customer_reviews.author: Cee Cee Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Really nice little grill. We bought it to take camping. A perfect size. Very lightweight and easy to take. Easily fits 6 hamburger patties. It’s nice because it doesn’t take too much charcoal for just the 2 of us to have a couple of burgers.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Williams

customer_reviews.title: You'll Love it for the Ease of Assembly
customer_reviews.text: This grill is the easiest to assemble. First, I must say, I have had cataract surgery in the past couple of months, my age is 70+ and I am female. This Weber grill was ready to fire up in about one hour. I think a younger person with average eyesight could do it in 20 minutes or so. I am so pleased with my purchase. Haven't even cooked on it yet but I love it. Thanks Weber.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Grill to Go
customer_reviews.text: Great grill! We took this on a long-distance trip for tailgating. It was easy to travel with/store, set up and get it started. Easy clean up afterwards. it heats up fast and kept it going. We'll be using this a lot in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE HANDLES remain loose— a MAJOR FLAW AND DANGER FOR A “PORTABLE” UNIT!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the American Weber charcoal grill of yesteryear. This is another CHEAP GRILL Made in China. DEFECTIVE HANDLES remain loose, due to faulty design— a MAJOR FLAW AND DANGER FOR A “PORTABLE” UNIT! Waste of time and money!
customer_reviews.author: Careful and Observant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small grill
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the versatility of this grill. Just the right size for a couple. Actually has more room for steaks and for grilling baked potatoes at the same. Has more surface coverage than the round grills of equal size. Also has many more air ports on sides, bottom and top.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Nice grill, but misrepresented by Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I paid a couple of dollars less because this was supposed to be “like new” but with damaged packaging. The cover was pushed down inside the bottom of the grill and there was only one piece of styrofoam left. The result was that there were now chips in the grill cover. The four washers for the legs were missing. I kept the grill because it’s a good design, but it will probably not last as long as it should and it was not in “like new” condition. This should not have been reshipped as it was; lack of quality control on Amazon’s part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing some parts
customer_reviews.text: It was missing some screws to hold the handles together. Haven't used it yet but seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: crescent wrench

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill for camping.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill strictly for alot of disperse camping that I do. Works great and has held up really well. I find myself using it at home for smaller cooking like pork chops, veggies, or shrimp for me and my girlfriend when I don't wanna start up my Kamodo.
customer_reviews.author: martin Galang

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. It was delivered without all pieces and a large dent.
customer_reviews.author: Rc

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: the best portable charcoal grill I have purchased in my 60+ years. This is amazing for the price. Very stable and study. But still reasonable in weight to carry or lift. Heats up well and holds heat well. The design is perfect for compact spaces, travel. 6 burgers fit comfortable on the grill. The handles do get quite warm.....not enough to burn your hand but it is very notable when you grab them for the first time. Only improvement would be for the handles to be made of another material instead of plastic that gets hot.
customer_reviews.author: dalinTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and weight
customer_reviews.text: Perfect portable charcoal grill for a small family. Tip: Cut the grate in half to store a small chimney starter, charcoal, fire starters, lighter, knife, small cutting board... all neatly with lid on.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Screws were troublesome
customer_reviews.text: Had some installation issues. The screws were extremely difficult to secure all the way in to form the handles properly.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking for two
customer_reviews.text: This is great if you’re cooking for two using the high heat method. More skilled people can probably do more with it. Clean up is super easy, I wish I got this to start of with for charcoal grilling. I always use the charcoal chimney for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat item. I'm impressed by the build quality and the warranty offered on all the hardware. It was very simple to put together and only required a phillips screw driver and 3 screws. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Love the size!
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and cannot wait to use it again. Portable and easy to carry. We made chicken and veggies for two. The food was cooked perfectly! The grill cooled off quickly once the air vents were closed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weber 121020 Go-Anywhere Charcoal Grill: An excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The Weber 121020 Go-Anywhere Charcoal Grill, is an excellent product. It exceeded my expectations. This is very well made and thought out. I enjoy using the grill and it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: ... my first charcoal grill and I must say I LOVE it. My current living conditions doesn't allow for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first charcoal grill and I must say I LOVE it. My current living conditions doesn't allow for such space for a full size charcoal grill, this little beauty is just perfect. It has a large enough space that I can cook meats such as chicken, ribs, sausages, burgers, you name it this baby handled it. Yet small enough that I can store it just about anyplace. Its easy to clean and light enough to move anywhere. Great purchase for my situation.
customer_reviews.author: HR Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are wrong
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this yet. It does seem to be fairly well built but my main complaint is that the posted dimensions are wrong. I went to Webber's website and the dimensions are wrong there as well so not the seller's fault. Cooking Surface is 16" x 10" Total Size (includes handles and vent wings): 14.5"H X 21"W X 11.2"D Note that the depth is 11.2 NOT 12.2.
customer_reviews.author: Reeses

product_meta.title: Weber 121020 Go-Anywhere Charcoal Grill,Black,14.5" H x 21" W x 12.25" L
product_meta.description:
While spending most days on your way to somewhere else, the Go-Anywhere portable charcoal grill brings a taste of home wherever you go. The lid locks for easy portability, and its rectangular shape fits perfectly in the back of most cars.

AMAZON.COM
Weber's Go-Anywhere charcoal grill makes a great companion for camping and tailgate parties. This compact unit has a surprisingly generous grilling area--large enough to fit four medium steaks. You can lock the lid into place with the pivoting legs and carry this lightweight grill around in one hand. Built-in lid hangers allow you to rest the lid on the side of the grill to create an effective barrier against the wind. The triple-nickel-coated steel grate is easy to clean, and the porcelain-enameled steel lid and cooking box are built to last.
feature_bullets: While spending most days on your way to somewhere else, the Go-Anywhere portable charcoal grill brings a taste of home wherever you go. The lid locks for easy portability, and its rectangular shape fits perfectly in the back of most cars.
Holds up to six burgers made with a Weber burger press
Compact and lightweight for grilling on the go
Porcelain-enameled lid and base retain heat, and won’t rust or peel
The lid locks for easy portability and dampers allow you to easily control the temperature inside your grill
Durable plated steel cooking grate retains heat and is easy to clean.Primary cooking area (square inches):160
3D interactive assembly instructions for this product are available through the free BILT app.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
